content: If compose box gets closed with a message on it and I open it again I would like to see the message that I typed restored on compose box. Its kind of painful to open the drafts and restore the message. Thoughts?

I think we debated this for a while a few months ago. I'm personally against auto-restoring drafts, because 90% of the time my draft is "n" from typing a hotkey while the compose box is open. I think people proposed some heuristic where if the message is too small, you don't restore it, but I feel like that leads to inconsistent behavior.
hmm. For people who don't use hot keys that much I think this won't be an issue. May be wean we have this as an option that user can enable in settings if enough people want this feature?
Maybe have a button next to Drafts that restores the last typed message?
The last typed message is on the top of the drafts, so it should be a d followed by an enter to restore the message.
Before introducing any new settings or changes to how the compose box works, I think the top priority is to clean up the drafts UI. The first message should be a lot more prominent than older drafts.
We could also consider shift-d to "restore last draft", or something.
